titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance publicity scrapbook MC.77
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Larkin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:32:35 -0500.

did.unittitle: New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance publicity scrapbook

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance

did.abstract: The New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance was established in 1900 to provide professional training for students pursuing a career in business. In 1988, the school was renamed the Leonard N. Stern School of Business. The collection contains a scrapbook with printed ephemera produced by the NYU School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance. The materials within the scrapbook promote the various programs and courses offered by the school. Materials date from 1936 to 1938.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown. There is no accession record associated with this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York University undergraduate School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance was established in 1900 to provide professional training for students pursuing a career in business. The school was presided over by Charles Waldo Haskins, the school's founding dean.

In 1972, the School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance was renamed the College of Business and Public Administration. In 1988, alumnus Leonoard N. Stern gave the school a generous donation, allowing the school to consolidate its graduate and undergraduate facilities at NYU's Washington Square campus. The school was renamed the Leonard N. Stern School of Business.
Today, NYU Stern is one of the nation's premier management education schools and research centers with a broad portfolio of academic programs at the graduate and undergraduate levels.
1. NYU Stern, "History", accessed November 19, 2018, available online at http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/about/history
2. NYU Stern, "Timeline", accessed November 19, 2018, available online at http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/about/history/timeline

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University School of Commerce Publicity Scrapbook; MC 77; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to November 2018 have not been recorded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a scrapbook with flyers, booklets, mailers, and brochures produced by the New York University School of Commerce, Accounts and Finance. The materials within the scrapbook promote the various programs and courses offered by the school. Materials date from 1936 to 1938.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
